org.csstudio.platform.internal.simpledal
Class AbstractConnector

java.lang.Object
  org.csstudio.platform.internal.simpledal.AbstractConnector
Direct Known Subclasses:
DalConnector, LocalConnector
abstract class AbstractConnector
extends java.lang.Object

Base class for connectors. For convinience the IProcessVariableValueListener´s are only weakly referenced. The connector tracks for IProcessVariableValueListener´s that have been garbage collected and removes those references from its internal list. This way IProcessVariableValueListener´s must not be disposed explicitly.

Author:
Sven Wende

Nested Class Summary
(package private) static interface AbstractConnector.IRunnable
          Runnable which is used to forward events to process variable value listeners.

isDisposable

public boolean isDisposable()
Determines, whether this connector can get disposed. This is, when no value listeners for the connector live in the JVM anymore.

Returns:
true, if this connector can be disposed, false otherwise

execute

private void execute(AbstractConnector.IRunnable runnable)
Executes the specified runnable for all existing value listeners. Only for valid listeners that still live in the JVM, the hook method AbstractConnector.IRunnable.doRun(IProcessVariableValueListener) is called.

Parameters:
runnable - the runnable

cleanupWeakReferences

private void cleanupWeakReferences()
Removes weak references for value listeners that have been garbage collected.
